IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY HEALTHCARE SERVICES ACCESSIBLE TO ALL THROUGH PRIMARY CARE, SPECIALIZED CARE AND OUTREACH AND ENROLLMENT SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY HEALTHCARE SERVICES ACCESSIBLE TO ALL.
IRS990.Desc: 65,905 MEDICAL VISITS WERE PROVIDED DURING 2018. PRIMARY HEALTH CARE MEDICAL SERVICES INCLUDE: PRIMARY CARE PROVIDED BY PHYSICIANS, PHYSICIAN ASSISTANTS, NURSE PRACTITIONERS, AND NURSES; IMMUNIZATIONS AND WELL-CHILD EXAMS, PEDIATRICS, PERINATAL AND FAMILY PLANNING, WOMEN'S HEALTH SERVICES, OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY, MIDWIFERY, OPHTHALMOLOGY, PODIATRY, PEDIATRIC EYE AND EAR SCREENINGS, OTORHINOLARYNGOLOGY, WALK IN SERVICES FOR ESTABLISHED PATIENTS AND LABORATORY ON-SITE. SEE SCHEDULE O FOR MORE INFORMATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES INCLUDE: BRIEF THERAPY COUNSELING, AND MEDICATION MANAGEMENT VISITS WITH A PSYCHIATRIST, NURSE PRACTITIONER, TELE-PSYCHIATRIST OR LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKER. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, 6,763 VISITS WERE PROVIDED TO INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECT CONTACT WITH LEGISLATORS: MEETINGS WERE HELD WITH LOCAL LEGISLATORS, STATE AND FEDERAL, AND THEIR KEY STAFFERS TO DISCUSS THE FEDERAL FUNDING CLIFF AND THE POTENTIAL IMPACT ON LOSS OF FUNDING TO THE COMMUNITY.
OTHER LOBBYING ACTIVITIES: THE ORGANIZATION PAYS ANNUAL DUES TO THE ILLINOIS PRIMARY HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION. A PORTION OF THESE DUES PAID MAY BE ATTRIBUTABLE TO LOBBYING PURPOSES.

INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS: THE ORGANIZATION HAS TRANSFERRED ASSETS TO THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF CENTRAL ILLINOIS TO ESTABLISH AN ENDOWMENT, THE PROCEEDS FROM WHICH ARE TO BE USED FOR EMERGENCY PHARMACEUTICAL ASSISTANCE. THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS RETAIN THE DISCRETION TO REQUEST DISBURSEMENT OF THE ENTIRE FUND EVERY THREE YEARS; THEREFORE, THE INTEREST IN THESE ASSETS ARE INCLUDED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS. INCOME IS DISTRIBUTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AGREEMENT WITH THE FOUNDATION AND IS INCLUDED IN TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS.

UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS: MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
AMOUNTS INCLUDED ON LINE 1, BUT NOT ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 12: $ (501,857) BAD DEBT EXPENSE 88,359 NET ASSETS RELEASED FROM RESTRICTION ----------- $ (413,498)
AMOUNTS INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 12, BUT NOT ON LINE 1: $ 61,929 TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED CONTRIBUTIONS
AMOUNTS INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 25, BUT NOT ON LINE 1: $ 501,857 BAD DEBT EXPENSE
HEALTH CLUB DUES: HEARTLAND COMMUNITY HEALTH CLINIC PAID HEALTH CLUB DUES FOR CHARLES BANDOIAN. THE ENTIRE AMOUNT WAS TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
COMPENSATION CONTINGENT UPON ORGANIZATION NET EARNINGS: A PERFORMANCE BASED BONUS WAS ESTABLISHED WITH MANY CRITERIA. ONE OF THESE CRITERIA IS BASED ON POSITIVE NET EARNINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE M, PART I, COLUMN B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS: THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS FOR DRUGS AND MEDICAL SUPPLIES WAS DETERMINED BY THE NUMBER OF UNITS OF MEDICAL SUPPLIES AND VACCINES RECEIVED. THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS FOR DONATED EQUIPMENT AND FORMULA WAS DETERMINED BY THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED.

VISION STATEMENT: HEARTLAND WILL BE THE MEDICAL HOME OF CHOICE. HEARTLAND WILL BE A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED LEADER WITH THE BEST CARE MODEL FOR ALL THAT CLOSES THE GAP IN RACIAL, ETHNIC, AND ECONOMIC HEALTH CARE DISPARITIES. HEARTLAND EMPLOYEES WILL FIND JOY AND MUTUAL RESPECT WITHIN THEIR WORKPLACE, DRAWING STRENGTH FROM DIVERSITY IN AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH.

PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITY #1 DESCRIPTION (CONTINUED): OVER THE PAST THREE YEARS, THE ORGANIZATION'S PAYOR MIX HAS AVERAGED AS FOLLOWS: 67% MEDICAID, 5% SELF PAY, 18% MEDICARE, 9% PRIVATE INSURANCE, AND 1% OTHER. WELLNESS AND HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS INCLUDE NUTRITION AND WELL BABY VISITS. SCREENING AND DISEASE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED FOR THE COMMUNITY HEALTH RISKS OF DIABETES, ASTHMA AND HYPERTENSION. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR 72,668 MEDICAL VISITS WERE PROVIDED TO 22,435 INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WERE MADE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR: MISSION STATEMENT - THE CORPORATION'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY HEALTH CARE SERVICES ACCESSIBLE TO ALL. GENERAL DIRECTORS - AT LEAST SIX, BUT NO MORE THAN FORTY-NINE PERCENT OF THE DIRECTORS SHALL BE ELECTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND SHALL BE NON-USERS AS THAT TERM IS DEFINED IN SECTION 3.5. USER DIRECTORS - AT LEAST SEVEN USER DIRECTORS SHALL BE ELECTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND NO LESS THAN FIFTY-ONE PERCENT OF THE DIRECTORS SHALL BE USER DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 990 REVIEW PROCESS: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION. PRIOR TO FILING, A DRAFT OF THE 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY TOP MANAGEMENT, AND A FINAL DRAFT WILL BE REVIEWED AND DISCUSSED AT A MEETING OF THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY ALL EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS ANNUALLY. ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST MUST BE FULLY DISCLOSED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN WRITING AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE AFTER THE CONFLICT BECOMES KNOWN. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ACTING WITHOUT THE VOTE OF ANY DIRECTOR WHO MAY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO THE MATTER AT HAND, SHALL DETERMINE THE OPTIMUM COURSE FOR ELIMINATING THE CONFLICT AND MINIMIZING ANY APPEARANCE THAT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. ANY DIRECTOR WHO MAY HAVE A CONFLICT SHALL NOT BE COUNTED IN THE QUORUM FOR A MEETING WHEN BOARD ACTION IS TO BE TAKEN ON THE MATTER. THESE REQUIREMENTS SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS PREVENTING THE DIRECTOR FROM BRIEFLY STATING HIS/HER POSITION IN THE MATTER OR FROM ANSWERING PERTINENT QUESTIONS OF OTHER DIRECTORS. ALL ACTIONS TAKE ON MATTERS WHICH INVOLVE A CONFLICT SHALL CLEARLY REFLECT, IN THE MINUTE OF SUCH ACTION, THAT THESE REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET. ANY DIRECTOR WITH A CONFLICT WILL NOT TAKE PART IN ANY BOARD ACTION ON SUCH MATTERS AND, AT THE REQUEST OF ANOTHER DIRECTOR, WILL BE PROHIBITED FROM TAKING PART IN ANY DISCUSSION ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A & 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION REVIEW PROCESS: THE ORGANIZATION SETS THE SALARY FOR THE CEO YEARLY. AT THAT TIME, COMPARABLE SALARY DATA FOR A CEO OF A COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER WAS OBTAINED FROM THE ILLINOIS PRIMARY HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION, THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS, PAY SCALE, ADP AND MGMA. THE FINAL SALARY WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE PROCESS WAS DOCUMENTED APPROPRIATELY IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEETING MINUTES. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PERFORMS AN ANNUAL EVALUATION OF THE CEO'S COMPENSATION AND MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ANY SALARY ADJUSTMENTS. A SALARY SCALE FOR ALL EMPLOYEES WAS DEVELOPED USING LOCAL DATA, ILLINOIS PRIMARY CARE ASSOCIATION SALARY SURVEY DATA, AND NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS SALARY SURVEY DATA FOR ALL RANGES ON THE SCALE. THIS SALARY SCALE WAS UPDATED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE PROCESS WAS DOCUMENTED APPROPRIATELY IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENT DISCLOSURE: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON APPROPRIATE WRITTEN REQUEST. SUCH DOCUMENTS WILL BE MAILED OR E-MAILED TO REQUESTORS.
